citeinfo.title: The StreamCat Dataset: Accumulated Attributes for NHDPlusV2 (Version 2.1) Catchments for the Conterminous United States - 2006 National Land Cover Database

pubinfo.publish: US EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Health and Environmental Effects Research Laboratory (NHEERL)

descript.abstract:
This dataset represents data derived from the NLCD dataset and the National Hydrography Dataset version 2.1(NHDPlusV2) (see Data Sources for links to NHDPlusV2 data and NLCD). Attributes were calculated for every local NHDPlusV2 catchment and accumulated watershed to provide watershed-level metrics for classes within the NLCD.
This data set is derived from the NLCD raster composed of 16 land cover classes (categorical data type) for the conterminous USA. Four classes of the NLCD were excluded as they were specific to Alaska land covers. This raster was produced based on a decision-tree classification of circa 2006 Landsat satellite data (see Data Structure and Attribute Information for a description of each metric).
descript.purpose: These data were created in support of the US EPAâ€™s National Aquatic Resource Survey (NARS) and Safe and Sustainable Waters Resources (SSWR) Programs. However, these watershed summaries of landscape data should have broad applicability for hydrological, geomorphic, or ecological modelling, management, and restoration. For details on EPA NARS and SSWR Programs see http://water.epa.gov/type/watersheds/monitoring/aquaticsurvey_index.cfm and http://www.epa.gov/research/progressreport/water.htm
descript.supplinf:
All code and scripts used to produce these data were written in the python or R programming languages and are freely available at ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/Code/
Glossary of Terms
Stream Segment: NHDPlusV2 line describing a section of contiguous stream or river between upstream and downstream tributaries (as depicted in USGS topographic quadrangles), except where the segment is a headwater or terminal stream.
COMID: Unique identifier for each stream segment, and associated catchment, in NHDPlusV2. Watershed metrics describe entire area of all catchments that accumulate to the specific catchment based on the NHD PlusFlow table.
Catchment (Cat): The portion of the landscape where surface flow drains directly to an NHDPlusV2 stream segment, excluding any upstream contributions.
Watershed (Ws): The set of hydrologically-connected catchments, consisting of all upstream catchments that contribute flow to any local catchment.
Riparian Buffer (Rp100): Spatial buffer of 100-m that was added to NHDPlusV2 stream network and NLCD water pixels. The buffers were used to spatially constrain calculations for some landscape metrics to within 100 meters of the riparian area.
Landscape Layer: Any geospatial layer from which we derived statistical summaries for both local catchments and watersheds. These landscape layers were comprised of several GIS formats, including vector (points, lines, or polygons) and raster.

idinfo.useconst: None. While EPA has used its best efforts to include complete and accurate information in the EME, EPA cannot be held responsible

procstep.procdesc: Datasets downloaded from http://www.mrlc.gov/nlcd06_data.php and http://www.horizon-systems.com/NHDPlus/NHDPlusV2_data.php. Data source, date, units and resolution were recorded in a project tracking spreadsheet and verified (LR)
Projection of datasets verified as USGS Albers Equal Area Conic and projected as such if necessary

Performed a visual inspection of datasets for gaps, edges other anomalous features. Verified how no-data values were represented and recoded values as no-data where appropriate (for instance, if no-data locations represented by 0's or -9999, these were converted to no-data values).

Ran zonal statistics python script (StreamCat.py) to calculate zonal statistics for all NHDPlusV2 catchments in each NHDPlusV2 Vector Processing Unit (VPU). Zonal statistics were perofrmed using either ZonalStatisticsAsTable, TabulateArea, or spatially joining vector point data to catchments. Each method applies to the type of landscape layer being evaluated, Continuous, Categorical, or Point. We also calculated the percent of each catchment that had coverage by a given landscape layer (i.e. was not null). These results are accumulated using the NHDPlusV2 flow table to summarize upstream catchment values and complete watershed values for the metric.

Clean and standardize results of zonal statistics table from accumulation script / process (makeFinalTables.py). Clean up consisted of calculating mean value of metric per zone, renaming and sorting zonal statistics fields, and writing zonal results to .csv file.

pubinfo.publish: Fry, J., Xian, G., Jin, S., Dewitz, J., Homer, C., Yang, L., Barnes, C., Herold, N., and Wickham, J.

citeinfo.origin: United States Geological Survey (USGS) and US EPA
citeinfo.title: National Hydrography Dataset Plus

enttyp.enttypd: Percent of the NHDPlusV2 local catchment and accumulated watershed composed of each NLCD2006 land cover class.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID label to each catchment in NHDPlusV2
Area of the catchment measured in square kilometers.
Percent of the catchment that is covered by the landscape raster.
Area of the watershed measured in square kilometers.
Percent of the watershed that is covered by the landscape raster.
Percent open water land cover (class 11) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent perennial cover of ice and/or snow land cover (class 12) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent developed, open space land use (class 21) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent developed, low intensity land use (class 22) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent developed, medium intensity land use (class 23) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent developed, high intensity land use (class 24) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent barren Land land cover (class 31) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent deciduous forest land cover (class 41) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent mixed conifer forest land cover (class 42) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent mixed deciduous/conifer forest land cover (class 43) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent shrub/scrub land cover (class 52) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent grassland/herbaceous land cover (class 71) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent pasture/hay land use (class 81) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent row crop land use (class 82) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent woody wetland land cover (class 90) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent emergent herbaceous wetland land cover (class 95) in the local catchment (Cat)
Percent open water land cover (class 11) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent perennial cover of ice and/or snow land cover (class 12) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent developed, open space land use (class 21) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent developed, low intensity land use (class 22) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent developed, medium intensity land use (class 23) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent developed, high intensity land use (class 24) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent barren Land land cover (class 31) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent deciduous forest land cover (class 41) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent mixed conifer forest land cover (class 42) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent mixed deciduous/conifer forest land cover (class 43) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent shrub/scrub land cover (class 52) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent grassland/herbaceous land cover (class 71) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent pasture/hay land use (class 81) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent row crop land use (class 82) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent woody wetland land cover (class 90) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Percent emergent herbaceous wetland land cover (class 95) in the total upstream watershed (Ws)

overview.eaover: Each of the attributes listed describe the percentage of each local catchment and watershed composed of each land cover class.
